data.title: Ray Allen Player Profile, Miami Heat
data.meta_description: Get the latest news, stats and more about Ray Allen on RealGM.com
data.text: Jun 26, 1996 - The Minnesota Timberwolves selected Ray Allen in Round 1 with Pick 5 in the 1996 NBA Draft. Jun 26, 1996 - The Milwaukee Bucks acquired the Draft Rights to Ray Allen from the Minnesota Timberwolves in a trade. Jul 24, 1996 - Ray Allen signed a multi-year contract with the Milwaukee Bucks. Feb 6, 1999 - Ray Allen signed a rookie scale extension with the Milwaukee Bucks. Feb 20, 2003 - Ray Allen was acquired by the Seattle SuperSonics, along with Flip Murray, Kevin Ollie, a Least Favorable 2003 1st round pick and a TPE, from the Milwaukee Bucks in exchange for Desmond Mason and Gary Payton. Jul 1, 2005 - Ray Allen, previously with the Seattle SuperSonics, became a free agent. Aug 3, 2005 - Ray Allen signed a multi-year contract with the Seattle SuperSonics. Jun 28, 2007 - Ray Allen was acquired by the Boston Celtics, along with the draft rights to Glen Davis and a TPE, from the Seattle SuperSonics in exchange for Wally Szczerbiak, Delonte West, the draft rights to Jeff Green and a More Favorable 2008 2nd round pick. Jul 1, 2010 - Ray Allen, previously with the Boston Celtics, became a free agent. Jul 13, 2010 - Ray Allen signed a multi-year contract with the Boston Celtics. Jun 7, 2011 - Ray Allen exercised a Player Option to extend his contract. Jul 1, 2012 - Ray Allen, previously with the Boston Celtics, became a free agent. Jul 11, 2012 - Ray Allen signed a multi-year contract with the Miami Heat. Jun 28, 2013 - Ray Allen exercised a Player Option to extend his contract. Jul 1, 2014 - Ray Allen, previously with the Miami Heat, became a free agent. Jul 14, 2014 - The Miami Heat renounced their free-agent exception rights to Ray Allen.
